body:
Crazy! Great work - I am sure this one will be a blast to review ;-)

On Wed, Jul 16, 2014 at 5:27 PM, Jonathan Frederic <notifications@github.com

> wrote:
> 
> Hi all,
> 
> After @KesterTong https://github.com/KesterTong hacked together an
> outputarea IFrame implementation, I was determined to get the widgets to
> work with IFrames. At first I thought this would be very hard to do, then
> after I saw Kester's output area implementation I thought it would be easy,
> but I was wrong, the implementation was difficult. I had to detach the
> widget framework from any and all instance references to cell, comm, and
> comm_manager (this seemed to be the cleanest decoupling). It took a few
> days, but here is a _very_ rough draft. There are still loads of bugs and
> log comments everywhere. I've tested it with the IntTextWidget across two
> IFrames:
> 
> [image: iframewidgets]
> https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3292874/3607443/fe47bb40-0d48-11e4-821b-58539a8dded8.png
> 
> I'm going to continue hammering bugs into non-existance, clean everything
> up aesthetically, and then remove the logs. Once I'm done with that, I'll
> need to tackle the test framework... Which is probably going to be a
> disaster.
> 
> @KesterTong https://github.com/KesterTong - I did work on this on the
> flight back, but it just turned out to be more work than I anticipated
> which is why I didn't have it done sooner (and I fell asleep when I got
> home).
> 
> Also pinging @ellisonbg https://github.com/ellisonbg as an update of
> what I've been working on.
> 
> ## I'll draw a diagram of how this all works tomorrow...
> 
> You can merge this Pull Request by running
> 
>   git pull https://github.com/jdfreder/ipython outputframe
> 
> Or view, comment on, or merge it at:
> 
>   https://github.com/ipython/ipython/pull/6148
> Commit Summary
> - Changes outputarea to an iframe
> - Start moving code back into notebook dir.
> - renamed: outputframe/js/outputarea.js -> notebook/js/outputarea.js
> - Started getting widgets to work in iframes
> - Making some progress...
> - Finished extra rough implementation
> - Some more changes
> - Made some more progress
> - Even more progress, going to take a break
> - Adding callback methods
> - Finshed separating the comm and cell from the widget material.
> - Finished rough draft
> - Make all the features work!
>

I wonder if it could also be interesting to use the `/outputframe` page alone, without the main notebook, as a kind of "generated web app".

> I wonder if it could also be interesting to use the /outputframe page alone, without the main notebook, as a kind of "generated web app".

Interesting idea...  I suppose this would allow you to do that, if you used the messaging API.

Just a note, I was testing out Bokeh on coLaboratory, and I noticed that you have to call output_notebook() in every frame, because iframe isolation means that frames don't share a global namespace.

I suspect that for many libraries, the best we can do is reload the javascript in each iframe.  This is because even if you had access to the global Bokeh object, it's not clear that this object is usable in another iframe (because of globals like window and document).

> Dead for 3 month. Closing.

Thanks.   I will revisit this in a separate PR once the ipython-sec mailing list settles on an appropriate method and 3.0 has been released.
